intro: Veronica polita var. lilacina, commonly known as the lilacflower speedwell, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, giving it a textured appearance. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive flowers and compact growth habit.
